comment: Amazing professor and has great communication. Gives constructive feedback to help you improve. Lessons each week are interesting and useful, not just busy work.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Do not take this class if you want an easy A, there is a lot of material that is MANDATORY to watch (multiple long videos, articles to read, etc.). She also takes FOREVER to input grades so you really don't know what you have in the class until the end. I will say she will let you know if you forgot something if you submit before the deadline.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Slinger-Friedman's reviews are positive- but don't be fooled. This class is lecture-heavy and treats itself like it's supposed to be an upper-level class. I only needed this class for a science requirement and I regret taking it. Her lectures are so-so & there is no textbook to study with. She also grades tough. Be prepared!!!

She's AMAZING. She cares so much about her students and wants to see them succeed. Her lectures are long but they give all the info you need for the assessments, I just watched all her lectures, took the assessments right after, and got good scores. She is also very passionate about this subject, I appreciate her enthusiasm when she gives lectures.

Do not take her. She is super sweet and understanding but the amount of WORK she had was insane for an online environment class... So many papers, assignments, and outside activity work. One of the assignments was volunteering for 6 hours and writing a paper on top of it. Took it for an easy elective... I was so wrong. Save yourself the time.

Dr. Slinger is a ok teacher. Lectures aren't engaging. You have two weeks to complete each module and each has an overview sheet that you fill out with the videos. Using the overview sheets on the quiz helps out a lot. Semester long sustainability research project but its not hard at all. No tests or lockdown browser and no textbook required.
Really don't get why her ratings are so good. Very meh professor honestly

I took GEOG 1125. This class was pretty easy. If you do the overview sheets then you should pass the quizzes just fine. There is a bit to watch to fill out the overview sheets but it's not that bad. There are a few research assignments that were a little confusing but overall the class was easy. The professor was nice. I would take her again.

Took online for GEOG 1125. Not the easiest class ever, but isn't bad overall. A couple papers here, and there, but they were actually kind of fun. Quizzes aren't the easiest thing in the world, but if you do the overview sheets she gives you you'll make an easy B+, or A.

Dr. Slinger is a wonderful and insightful instructor. She is very responsive to questions, and make sure that every student is accommodated. Her courses are not easy, but if you put in the effort, its rewarding!

I took her online. To get a good grade on quizzes you have to go through every PowerPoint in the module. Do yourself a favor and not wait until the last minute to do work because it will get very stressful. She does not accept late work. most of your grade is based off discussions and quizzes. Grades heavily.

The lectures are usually 30+ minutes but if you take notes and pay attention you should pass the quizzes easily. The discussion boards require effort, with good responses to your classmates. Its not the hardest class but definitely does require a bit of effort.
good professor, was a lot for a 7 week online course. material heavy. must go through all powerpoints
Very great teacher, all assignments were easy to complete.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Very straightforward class. If you do take her, make sure you go through her powerpoints because there is a lot. However, if you put the time in watching the lectures you will do fine. Other than that, it's an easy 7-week course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took prof Slinger's online 7-week GEOG 1101, she makes you work hard for a grade, so if you want an A, prepare to: read a lot of articles, PowerPoint lectures, and assignments to do. It is a lot of work per week, but then again, this is a 7 week class, so if you can't take the heat, just go with the regular on-campus class. Great prof. though!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Amazing professor! Even if I didnt have her in person shes still one of the top professors Ive ever had! Since I took a 7 week course I always had to be on top of it every week turning something in! But it was straightforward from her lectures and videos she provides. Amazing professor (:

She is a great professor. Her course is very lecture heavy so if you don't have the time to sit and listen to her 20-60 minute lectures then I wouldn't recommend. 5 extra credit opportunities and she was very responsive to emails. 6 quizzes and she drops the lowest quiz grade at the end. I took her as a 7-week online course and it was really easy.

This course is very lecture heavy. If you're not able to stick to the schedule and listen the lectures you will not succeed. But if you can handle that, then there's no doubt you'll pass. There are no exams or textbooks, that is something I loved about the class as well as the extra credit opportunities. Other than the lectures, this is an easy A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I learned a lot more in this class than I anticipated. It gave we a wider understanding of how the world works and gave great insight into how we use tools to see patterns across the globe. This class was online and only half a semester, which freed up study time for others classes at the end of the semester. It is not hard to do well if you try.

Loooooved this class! Lectures are amazing, she offers a great variety of resources for people who learn differently, and you have the option to personally call her and ask her about anything. Super knowledgeable, passionate, fair, and loves her students. Absolutely take Dr. Slinger if you can! BE PREPARED to work for your grade.

I absolutely loved her GEOG1101 online class! It does take time and effort to complete but you have to understand that she has the responsibility of teaching a full 3 credit class in half the time traditionally given. She personally narrates all her lectures and is very hands on with her research. Totally inspiring and my favorite prof at KSU!

Dr. Slinger is a great teacher who really cares about actually teaching you the material. The tests in this class are important, but her notes are clear and when she really needs you to know something, she emphasizes it. She puts out study guides and is truly a fair grader. There are a couple of extra-credit opportunities too!

I really enjoyed this class. The topics are relevant and the presentation was excellent. I learned a lot.... so if you want to understand more about a topic, take her. The assignments allow you to focus on your interests related to the section topics. Go to class, do the work, and thank me later.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took this class online - fairly easy. She wants you to pass - but you do have to work hard. I'd take her again. Don't buy the book. Everything you need is in her lectures - but they are long lectures so be prepared to spend some serious time on this class.

Avoid the online class. Everything was difficult. She posted so many long lectures for each module. If you dont listen the lectures you will most likely fail the quizzes. Im surprised I passed with a B.

Professor Slinger is awesome. She shows videos to allow to actually see what she is teaching you about. Loved her class. She is super nice and willing to work with you if you need help inside or outside of class. Her tests are hard because of wording, so make sure you are very diligent in studying. I would love to take her again if I could!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Tests are tough

comment: graded the discussions hard, and the tests were rather extensive.
Great professor, cares about her students for sure. The assignments weren't my favorite but that's just personal preference. Definitely take her if you can!

This was the best professor I've ever taken online! I was nervous to take a 7 week course online but she made the modules and assignments clear and interesting. My favorite thing she did was have each student turn in a journal at the end of the module, where you could get clarification on a confusing aspect and she would reply in great detail.

Dr. Slinger tells you upfront what is expected in discussion posts as well as in essays and assignments.  She doesn't just hand out good grades.  You have to earn them, but if you pay attention to the lectures and read the chapters you will do well.  She responds promptly to emails and gives good feedback.  Definitely take her class!!

I took this as a 7 week course and there was way too much work involved. Her online lectures were long and not very descriptive, she didn't always answer questions clearly and didn't provide feedback for the discussions. If you're willing to put effort into the assignments, it's not bad. Otherwise, take someone else.

She is very good teacher. If you want an A, you do need to come to class and take notes and study for the test. It does require working hard to get an A. She does post notes online but it is still helpful to come to class b/c notes are brief. There are 3 papers, 3 tests, 3 quizzes, 3 article analysis. If you put in effort, this class is an easy A

Dr. Slinger is an excellent professor! I love the way she teaches. She does expect you to read the material prior to class and there are quizzes, but the reading is easy. There are three mandatory field trips and they are awesome! She has guest lecturers. The project at the end is a great experience! Highly recommend!
Best professor here at Kennesaw in my opinion. If you go to class and take notes then you will get an A

She is a really good teacher. She has traveled the world so she knows what she is talking about. You take 5 map quizzes and she drops the lowest and your final is just a 4th Exam, nothing cumulative. She is very interested in what students have to say and if they have been anywhere she likes for you to share. She is highly recommended in my books.
Professor Slinger is wonderful. Her lectures are interesting and her grading system is easy. Her tests can be challenging. Go to class and take notes! She gives some extra credit opportunities too!

One of the best professors I have had at KSU! She really cares about her students, and she you can tell she loves her job. Very engaging and fun. I wish I could take more classes with her. Tests were a little difficult, but you have plenty of assignments, map quizzes, and extra credit  to boost your grade up.
Had her for GEOG 2105 December minimester online and she was great. Easy class, clear PowerPoints, and interesting readings.

Great teacher makes class fun brings in items from places that we are studying if she has been there.  If you don't understand something or just need help with how to study or something like that she is a great help and it is easy to get a hold of her

Great Professor! She loves what she teaches and loves to hear student's stories about other regions of the world. Very nice, she wants you to due well and will sit with you if you have any questions. Teaches from a powerpoint but everything you need for a test is right there. TAKE HER!

OMG! I LOVE Professor Friedman. Amazing teacher who actually WANTS you to pass. She gives a 5 quizzes over geographic locations(easy) and 4 exams over course material(50 mult. questions, easy).2 extra credit assignments, and that's all. Shes very passionate about teaching and if you get on her good side she'll be lenient with you. Amazing professor

Dr. Slinger-Friedman was a great instructor. I took her class online and had no problems with her promptly replying to any questions. She was very organized, and was very helpful with sending a reminder of an assignment. Pay close attention to the power points and do all of the assignments on time and you should have no problems getting an A.
I took this class online. It was fairly easy. She is very organized, so it is easy to locate your assignments. Just follow the modules, watch the videos, and read in the book.

her class is pretty easy for the most part. she has more than jsut test grades for the class so if you don't do well on something, you have multiple ways to bring your grade up. the only problem is her exams.  they are very wordy. all i can say is pay attention, but overall interesting and easy class

Dr. Slinger made the class really interesting. The tests are a bit hard but if you attend class then there will be extra credit opportunities. Map quizzes are easy if you study for them and she provides the tools you need to study. I would take this class again!
What an awesome teacher and class! I especially enjoyed her talking about her own travels. Come to class, print power points and you will make an A.

She is NOT as easy as everyone says. I took her and went to every class and studied for her tests and still made a C! Tests are very wordy! But if you go to class she gives extra credit for attending. Map quizzes are easy but tests are NOT.

She made the class interresting. I would recommend anyone take her class! The only downfall to this particular class was a three part paper that was very rushed and the expectations were unclear. Other than that, there are 2 map quizzes, plenty of extra credit, and 2 tests.
Great class, apply yourself in class and learn the material, you will receive an A. She's absolutely gorgeous and the ONLY professor at KSU I have a crush on.

She grades very easily. Read the power-points thoroughly and pay attention and you should get an "A", but reading the book will help even more. She will allow students to speak, often too much as the most ignorant people seem to speak the most in her class.

Such a great teacher. She is tough when it comes to making an A just because there isn't very many chances to make up for a bad grade but she is very clear and precise on exactly what she expects so its hard not to do well as long as you pay attention. Go to class! She gives a lot of extracredit for attendance that can help your final grade.

This professor is very clear and understandable with her teaching and with her directions for assignments. There are quite a few small assignments, a small paper, and one large research project. It seems like a lot of work, but she grades fairly I found most of it to be interesting and relevant.I recommend this professor.The class ended in October.

Everyone is right in that she is funny and she makes the class interesting, but what no one mentions is that there are such few assignments in her class that if you mess up you don't have any room to bounce back. You can only miss a total of 21 points to get an A. She grades the final presentation rather harshly and there is TOO much material!
Very interesting class. Come prepared to work. Fairly hard test and reading assessments. Project is fairly easy. Highly recommend her.

This is a wonderful and very helpful teacher, she keeps class interesting because she has seen a lot of what is discussed in class. A few map quizzes, some other extra assignments, and two tests. So a lot of opportunities to get an A! HIGHLY recommended.

Requires regular attendance. Excellent method of teaching with regular map quizzes. Study is needed for the exams but the multiple choice are pretty straight forward. I would definitely recommend this professor to anyone!

Took her for two classes (1101 and 3370) and made geog my minor just to take more with her. She's an amazing teacher! TAKE HER!!! She's a very nice person, fun, easy going. By far the best professor at KSU.

So very hot! Very easy to pay attention to her not just because of looks.  She is organized in thought very interested in imparting her large breadth of geography knowledge to her students. Very fun class atmosphere. Did I mention she is HOT!

Professor Slinger has been my favorite teacher at kennesaw to date! she makes geography interesting and adds her personal experiences to the chapters. we did not need a book and everything was posted in powerpoints. she takes attendance but i missed a few days and it didnt hurt my grade. definately take her class!!

Awesome teacher. This is actually the 2nd time I have taken her and hope to be able to take her again. She really loves what she does and has many activities that make the class a lot of fun. I recommend her to everyone! The tests aren't hard either.

Loved Mrs. Slinger! She's amazing! this class was very interesting and she's very into the topic. shes traveled all over and brings in the things shes gotten from other countries. i enjoyed this class and it was an easy A if you paid attention! definately recommended!
Liked both the class and the professor.  Very informative.

Dr. Slinger is a GREAT professor. Quizzes are easy and tests are simple, if you STUDY. Some assignments take time, but her class is definitely worth it. She's tries to make lectures interesting and keep the class involved. I would highly recommend her!!

Dr Slinger is a good instructor. Attend class, pay attention, study and you should do well. Tests and quizzes are fair. She is accessible and likes students to add to discussion, ask questions and show interest.  She obviously loves geography and enjoys teaching. PowerPoints are helpful but you really need to attend class to learn and do well.
Very pretty woman with ability to relate to all aspects of the course for she has traveled the world and loves her subject.

She is a great teacher. If you go to class and pay attention you will do great. And class is usually fun, not boring. She has been all over the world and ties in her personal experiences with her lectures. SHe's great, definitely take her. You will learn a lot and enjoy class.

she's ok...but i wouldn't agree that her class is always upbeat. actually, on an average class day that consists of the hour-long powerpoint of notes, i usually notice quite a few students trying to stay awake...and most unable to. she's reallllllly rude when you come in late so ALWAYS be early.
I LOVE Dr. Slinger!  So far she's my favorite professor.  Highly Recommended!!!
Best at KSU. Take her if you can!!!!! She makes the class interesting and she is funny ~  Highly Reccomended
Very easy class if you put any kind of effort into it. map quizzes are a easy A

Great Teacher!! Very clear, super nice, never boring. very upbeat! Take her for 1101.  You will learn alot.  Attendence policy -gives extra credit. 5 quizzes(easy) and 4 exams.(hard)  You have to study!

Super nice lady. gives 5 map quizes and drops the lowest one.  There are 4 exams (tough). Powerpoint notes.  takes some study time! Overall very interested class.. She is very upbeat, knows her subject, very friendly.  Best Geog teacher there is at KSU!
wonderful teacher, very helpful, has a lot of fun in class, and makes it very interesting, easy to get in contact with, easy A as long as you go to class.
Excellent Teacher!!! Highly recommended!  She is super helpful and so nice.  Very fun class.  You will have no regrets by taking her.
Awesome prof. She makes class very interesting every week. Best teacher I have had in college. If you turn up to class, you will ace this class.

V Slinger-Friedman, is a great teacher, class is never boring, notes are downloadable, tests aren't tricky and test on revelent material. This is a new class, and you will learn a lot. Class is fun, and she is very approachable. She is very eager to answer your questions
She's cool.  A lot of guest speaker.  Map quizzes are easy- test are a little harder.  Download Pwr Point slides and bring them to class, then write all over them!!!!
Great teacher! She makes it interesting. The class seems easy because you want to listen.. doing well on the test is easy. If you are there and listen you will do well.

This class was extremley easy and she really cares about her students and will make sure you're keeping up with the material.  The class is really boring, but then again, it's geography.  An easy A and a very nice teacher. I'll take it...

I love Dr. Slinger. She is a bright individual that shows her abilities in every lecture. If she does not know something, she honestly lets us know and WILL investigate it to find out. She is far better than some professors I have had.

Vanessa Slinger-Friedman is one of the best teachers I have ever had. The key word being teacher, most professors dont care, much less actually care about teaching. This one is terrific, I wish she were teaching every class I was taking.
